p.s: The present extract from Remarks of president Barack Obama at student roundtable, spoken by Barack Obama, during a visit to Istanbul in Turkey at the Culture and Arts Center of Mimar Sinan Fine Arts University in Tophane, at April 7th 2009, deals with student exchanges and intercultural understanding.
Obama states, that he is very proud of his country and their inhabitants.
He tells the audience about their engagement in volunteering.
Furthermore, Barack wants to support the young people experiencing different cultures by doing a student exchange.
The ex-president thinks that exchange programmsprograms can help people learning new languages, and that it can help building a connection and a sense of togetherness all around the globe.
Through going abroad, people can share their culture and their common experiences to rebuild the sense of a common humanity.
Student exchanges are a first step to peace, because of them, we are able to build new bridges.
To conclude, Barack Obama explains the advantages of student exchanges and wants to convince the audience to go abroad.
